H6691.def: = man; ◄ {L:Naamathite<SDBH:נַעֲמָתִי>}; ► friend of {L:Job<SDBH:אִיֹּוב>} who comes to comfort but concludes by arguing with Job

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H907.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H4962.def: = human beings, regardless of sex and age

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H3932.def: only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3637.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3948.def: = causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech

H2134.def: = state in which a substance has not been mixed or adulterated with any other substance

H1249.def: aramaism: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

H199.def: = marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3718.def: = state in which an object consists of two layers, ► which enhances its strength

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5382.def: = action when one is no longer able to remember or recall a person or a past experience

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H2714.def: = action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H1363.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4055.def: = a generic word for clothing, which in certain contexts may denote a specific kind of clothes, such as someone's tunic or armor

H752.def: = pertaining to being relatively lengthy in size

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7342.def: = state in which an object is large in size

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2498.def: = process by which an object appears in a certain location

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H4962.def: = human beings, regardless of sex and age

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H5014.def: = state in which an object has empty space inside

H3823.def: literally: to get heart; hence: = process by which humans learn to think for themselves as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do

H5895.def: = young male {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>}; ≈ possibly associated with liveliness and unruliness

H6501.def: = wild donkey of a relatively large size but with relatively small ears; it has a fawn color with a whitish chest and belly; ◄ Persian Wild Ass or Onager, Equus hemonius; ≈ associated with both untameable wildness and sexual desire

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H6566.def: = causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

6.gl: to be committed (to someone or something)

16.gl: to spread out one's hands > to pray

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3971.def: = state in which humans or animals have a physical defect on their body

H3332.def: = process by which liquids flow from one place to another

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2465.def: primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

H5774.def: = process by which an object moves through the air

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H2658.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H983.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H7257.def: = action by which humans or animals assume a horizontal position, either to rest or to attack

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2729.def: = state/process by which inanimate objects shake or tremble violently

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H4498.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H4646.def: literally "breathing of soul"; hence: = process by which humans breathe for the last time before dying

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it
